speaker: Skyline
text: Plane with KACL banner.  _ACT I  Scene 1 - KACL Frasier is taking a call._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Morrie, if you're not cheating on your wife, and she still suspects you, then we're obviously dealing with a trust issue.

speaker: Morrie
text: [_v.o._] More like a crazy issue.  And I know where she gets it, from her mother -- who, by the way, came for Thanksgiving and still hasn't left.  Happy New Year!

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps we should tackle these issues one at a time...

speaker: Morrie
text: I'm in the bathroom, Celeste!  A little privacy?! [_into phone_] See how she gets?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, perhaps what is needed here is...

speaker: Celeste
text: [_v.o._] You think I don't know who you're talking to in there, huh, Morrie?  It's your little whore, isn't it?  Hello, whore.

speaker: Frasier
text: Celeste, if I could interrupt for just a moment...

speaker: Celeste
text: A man?!  It's worse than I thought.

speaker: Mother
text: [_v.o._] Celeste?

speaker: Celeste
text: Hang up, Ma!

speaker: Mother
text: You're all on the radio.  I'm listening down in the kitchen.

speaker: Morrie
text: How about washing a dish or two while you're down there?

speaker: Britney
text: [_v.o._] I cannot stand this yelling!  I'm running away from home.

speaker: Morrie
text: Oh, hang up the phone, Britney, you're going nowhere.

speaker: Frasier
text: And neither is this conversation. [_He cuts off the line._] Well, that's our show for today, with a brief program note.  My KACL colleagues and I are competing against a team at KPXY to see who can shed the most pounds for charity.  We're off to  our first weigh-in right now. You can keep track of our progress  on Channel 6's  _Bulldog, Kenny, Gil, and Noel rapidly enter the studio carrying cake boxes, bags, etc._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Okay, everybody, let's power this crap down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?

speaker: Kenny
text: The more you eat before the contest, the more you artificially boost your starting weight.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, we got cheeseburgers, donuts, french fries, tacos...

speaker: Gil
text: And a duck confit that's as rich as Donald Trump and twice as greasy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it hardly seems in the spirit of the competition.  The entire purpose here is to raise awareness about the obesity epidemic in this country...

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, Frasier, the winning team gets a free trip to Vegas!

speaker: Gil
text: Four glorious days in Sin City, with all its gaudy brilliance, the feathered headdresses, the fishnet stockings...[_He eats a morsel._]

speaker: Kenny
text: I'm just wearing an aloha shirt, myself.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Come on, Shempsky, pick up the pace.

speaker: Noel
text: I have a digestive disorder where if I eat too much or too little I get incapacitating stomach cramps.

speaker: Roz
text: It's OK, Noel, you do what's right for you. [_suggestively, moving closer to him_] But wouldn't a trip to Vegas be really fun?  And remember, what happens in Vegas... [_enticingly brings a donut to his face_] stays in Vegas.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Eat up, Doc!

speaker: Frasier
text: I will do no such thing!  It is not fair, and it is unsportsmanlike.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ah, who's it gonna hurt?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Shake it off, kid, nobody likes a whiner.  _Bulldog slaps Noel's head.  FADE OUT_  **PIGEON DROPPING**  _Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment Martin opens the door to Niles and Daphne_

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rushing to the powder room_] Oh, no time for chitchat, pregnant lady coming through.

speaker: Martin
text: [_noticing that Niles has a bandage on his hand_] What happened to your wrist?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, she rolled over in her sleep and pinned me again. I even saw it coming this time, like the big rock in that

speaker: Martin
text: Does she know she did it?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, I didn't want to hurt her feelings, so I just-- I just, uh, made up an excuse... [_looking out to the balcony_] What is Eddie doing?  _Martin sits in his chair.  While he is speaking, Niles, notices something on the window, wipes it away with his handkerchief._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's waiting for a pigeon friend of his.  We call him Barney.  Flies on the balcony every day and they stare at each other.  Those crazy animals.  Yesterday they did it for three hours.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm not making it up, I watched them the whole time.  _As Niles sits, he bumps his sore wrist.  Daphne exits the powder room and sees him wince._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, is your wrist still bothering you, dear?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, just a little flare-up.

speaker: Daphne
text: Poor thing slept on it funny.  Woke up screaming like a dying rabbit.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras, how was the weigh-in?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it was appalling, thank you.  My teammates ridiculed me for not pigging out beforehand.  You know what is it about teams and, and competitions that just brings out the worst in people?

speaker: Martin
text: Here we go again.

speaker: Daphne
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Frasier and team sports are not a happy mix.  Freshman year, in a bid to please Dad...

speaker: Frasier
text: There is no need to tell that story.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier inadvertently joined the girls' field hockey team.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_off their chuckles_] The sign-up sheet said "F. Hockey." I assumed it meant "freshman" hockey.

speaker: Martin
text: The little plaid skirt didn't tip you off?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_seething_] I thought it was a kilt!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm starving.  Where should we go for dinner?

speaker: Daphne
text: What was that?

speaker: Martin
text: [_gasping_] Barney!  Oh, Daph, would you take Eddie to my room? I don't want him to see this.

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on, boy, come on now.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, how did this happen?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, now, Dad, birds do fly into windows.

speaker: Martin
text: I know, that's why I keep a safety smudge right there... huh, where'd it go?

speaker: Martin
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm, I'm, I'm sorry.  It's, it's a reflex.  I-I, I don't even know I'm doing it.

speaker: Martin
text: Are you happy?  You killed Eddie's little friend.  Poor little guy. [_then_] Well, what should we do, just kick him over the edge?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, wait, he's still breathing!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!  Pick him up!

speaker: Niles
text: But birds are notorious carriers of disease.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, here, use my hanky.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rejecting the hanky_] I'll take my chances.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't you quit on us, Barney!  You're gonna be good as new.  _They head back inside.  But Niles is watching Barney so intently that he bumps his own head on the glass._

speaker: Martin
text: [_as they re-enter_] See, that's why we need a safety smudge.  _FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Channel 6 studio Host Kelly is wrapping up with a chef._  [_N.B. Bess Armstrong reprises her role as morning-show host Kelly Kirkland from[[8.08]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_8/mary_christmas.html "Mary Christmas") Mary Christmas._]

speaker: Kelly
text: We'll be right back, to see how our teams are doing in the first week of our Fat to Fit Weight Loss Challenge, so stay right here.  _Kelly samples something from a spoon the chef offers.  The KACL team is to the side, wearing shorts and corporate T-shirts._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, look, it's them.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, those robes!  It makes them look like they're in some kind of cult.

speaker: Noel
text: Like the high priests of Asmodeus the Destroyer. [_off their looks_] Asmodeus - demon of lusts, eater of worlds.  Does nobody read my e-mails?

speaker: Kelly
text: Welcome back.  So let's see how our teams fared this week. Come on in, guys!  Come on in!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, who's that last guy on their team?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, uh, Wayne Shafter.  He's their new general manager.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_deep and ominous_] So...we meet again, Wayne Shafter.

speaker: Kenny
text: You know him?

speaker: Frasier
text: We went to high school together.  He was the captain of the football team - Mr. Popularity - and my chief rival for the affections of our Swedish exchange student Giselle Johannson- Janson.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, so, uh, how'd that work out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.  We got married and had six kids.  What do you think?

speaker: Frasier
text: Wayne Shafter?

speaker: Wayne
text: Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: Frasier Crane.

speaker: Wayne
text: Hey, F. Hockey! [_He laughs and shakes Frasier's hand._] What have you been up to?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you know, not much.  Harvard, Oxford, M.D., Ph. D., and then just recently, I...

speaker: Wayne
text: Hey, remember that time I took your chess set and made you cry?

speaker: Frasier
text: You did not make me cry.  I chose to cry as a tactic to elicit sympathy and thereby regain my chess set.

speaker: Wayne
text: [_scoffing_] I threw it in the dumpster behind the cafeteria, didn't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  It was never found.

speaker: Wayne
text: No, I did.

speaker: Kelly
text: [_who has been talking in the background_] And last up for KACL, my old friend, Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Kelly! [_He gives her a friendly embrace._]

speaker: Kelly
text: Hey, Fras, good to see you, get up.

speaker: Kelly
text: Ouch!  One pound heavier, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that can't be, I've added a salad to every meal.

speaker: Kelly
text: So, at the end of one week, it's KPXY down 17 pounds, KACL down 9.  That's all the time we have.  Join me tomorrow when my guests will be the Senior Citizens' Handbell Chorus.  Have a neat day!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pleading his case to his team_] Listen.  Muscle weighs more than fat, you know, and the way I've been working out lately...

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, save it, lard-ass.

speaker: Wayne
text: Hey, you know, Crane, when they say "Take one for the team," they don't mean another cruller. [_He laughs._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, shut up, Shafter, you're a cruller.

speaker: Wayne
text: Oh, give it up.  I'll drop you a postcard from Vegas.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll tell you what, we are going to win this competition, Mister.  And when we do, you will replace that chess set.

speaker: Wayne
text: Okay, deal.  But if we win, you're showing up at our station in your little field hockey uniform.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're on, you fat scoundrel.

speaker: Wayne
text: All right, shake on it.  _Wayne offers his hand.  Frasier goes to take it, and he pulls it away._

speaker: Wayne
text: Psych!  Oh, sorry.  Sorry, that wasn't cool.  Here you go.

speaker: Wayne
text: Psych!

speaker: Wayne
text: Hey, hey, hey, wait a minute, it's not a deal unless we shake on it.  Come on.

speaker: Wayne
text: Come on.  I wouldn't do it for a third time. [_He smiles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Wayne
text: Psych!  God, I missed you!  _He laughs heartily.  FADE OUT.  END OF ACT I  ACT II  Scene 4 - Frasier's apartment Niles and Daphne enter.  Niles has a whiplash brace on his neck._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Martin!

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad!

speaker: Niles
text: How's Barney doing?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's doing a lot better today.

speaker: Niles
text: Great.  I brought him a treat.  Millet and sunflower kernels with added calcium for beak conditioning. [_Daphne goes toward the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: Mmm.  What happened to your neck?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... [_He gives a sidelong glance at Daphne._] Fell out of bed.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's been so accident-prone lately.  Every morning it's something else.

speaker: Martin
text: Shamu jump the tank again?

speaker: Niles
text: Fortunately, I moisturized right before bed, so I squirted out like a watermelon seed.

speaker: Martin
text: You all right, son?

speaker: Frasier
text: Walked upstairs.

speaker: Niles
text: Why did you walk upstairs?

speaker: Frasier
text: Burning calories.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, I saw you on TV.  You know, that Kelly Kirkland is quite an actress.  I once saw her in a production of _Love Letters_ with Bill Nye, the Science Guy. [_indicating_] Tears.

speaker: Frasier
text: I've decided to rededicate myself to this diet.  The opposing team is captained by my old high school nemesis, Wayne Shafter.

speaker: Niles
text: [_gasps, then_] Which one was he?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thick neck, dead eyes... snapped your PBS umbrella.

speaker: Frasier
text: For the next two weeks, I shall be a speed-walking, calorie- burning, pound-shedding machine.  Daphne, didn't you purchase some sort of stomach-tightening apparatus for Dad?

speaker: Daphne
text: The Ab Blaster or the Flab Buster?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  I'll tell you what.  Bring me both of them.  I'll put them together, see if I can get a real good workout going.

speaker: Frasier
text: So... is that bird nesting in my cashmere scarf?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, we tried a whole bunch of them.  That's the one he likes best.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, that's it.  I want that sky rat out of here.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no!  Eddie will be crushed.  The bird's like his pet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Eddie _is_ a pet.  He doesn't get to have a pet.

speaker: Niles
text: [_petting the bird_] Well, I guess Barney has pretty well recovered.

speaker: Martin
text: [_wistfully_] Yeah, I guess.  Well, time to go, Barney.  Oh, Eddie, don't worry.  He'll come back and visit you.

speaker: Niles
text: It's kind of hard letting him go.

speaker: Niles
text: Now I know how you must have felt all those times when you dropped me off at musical theater camp.  Sad and frightened...

speaker: Martin
text: [_with a meaningful pause_] Lots of emotions, son.

speaker: Niles
text: Barney, remember us fondly as you spread your wings and soar free.  _Niles shuts his eyes and throws the bird upward.  Martin's eyes and head follow the bird as he drops like a rock._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, my God!  Barney!

speaker: Niles
text: [_searching the skies_] Where did he go?  Is he soaring free?

speaker: Martin
text: He bounced off the railing, and landed on the Cunninghams' balcony.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, look!  His wing just moved!  He's alive!

speaker: Martin
text: I'll go get him.

speaker: Niles
text: Hurry, hurry!

speaker: Niles
text: [_yelling down_] Don't you die!  I love you, you tough old bird! [_then_] Not you, Mrs. Cunningham.  _FADE TO:  Scene 5 - KACL Kenny is in the booth.  Bulldog enters.  Both of them are edgy._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, what did I tell you about smoking in the booth?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, bite me.  I need something to kill my appetite -besides your STUPID, UGLY FACE!!

speaker: Kenny
text: Gotcha, Bulldog.

speaker: Kenny
text: Ow!  What did I tell you about that?  [_N.B. In fact, David Hyde Pierce is the only member of the regular cast who does not smoke.  He also insists that Jane Leeves not have a cigarette before any scene that requires him to kiss her._]

speaker: Gil
text: Thieves!  Brigands!  I had three-and-a-half ounces of sashimi- grade ahi in the fridge and one of you has stolen it.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Not me.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it wasn't me!  And it wasn't Noel.  He thinks I'm going to do him in Vegas, so he's barely eaten in two weeks. [_She laughs._] That's why he keeps fainting.

speaker: Kenny
text: All right, I took it and I liked it!  What are you going to do about it? [_Bulldog pinches his nipple again._] Ow!  It wasn't even your fish! [_Bulldog pinches his other nipple._] OW!  _Unseen before, Noel now rises from the floor, bumping his head on the desk._

speaker: Noel
text: How long was I out that time?

speaker: Roz
text: [_suggestively_] Ten minutes, big boy.

speaker: Noel
text: I've got a bump the size of an egg.

speaker: Kenny
text: Don't say "egg."

speaker: Noel
text: Don't tell me what to say.

speaker: Gil
text: I'm still waiting for my ahi.

speaker: Roz
text: Put a sock in it, Princess.

speaker: Gil
text: How dare you?

speaker: Roz
text: How dare you!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Should I crack the egg, Noel, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: People!  People, STOP IT!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, listen, I understand that we're all a bit cranky...

speaker: Gil
text: Cranky?  We're starving.  I'm not sure I can hold on much longer.

speaker: Frasier
text: We've only got one day more to go.  We can't crack now when we're this close to victory!  All right, everyone - take a deep breath.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Roz, cough it all up.  We don't want any extra phlegm weight.

speaker: Noel
text: Whose birthday is it?

speaker: Kenny
text: Gina in accounting.

speaker: Roz
text: Who's Gina again?

speaker: Bulldog
text: New chick.  So-so face, a little big in the can.

speaker: Gil
text: Perhaps I'll go wish dear Gina well.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, good idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, that's the team spirit!  We may be dieting, but we can still nourish ourselves on some good office fellowship. Please give Gina my regards as well.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Okay, Doc, see ya.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to himself_] Oh, it's a good team... Good people...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizing_] Good God!  [_calling and running after them_] Wait! It's not worth it!  It's sheetcake!   **BYE BYE BIRDIE**  _Scene 6 - Frasier's apartment The team are all there.  Bulldog is wearing a loud silver jumpsuit and doing rapid step exercises, up and down the little step.  Gil is seated on the couch, Kenny is in Martin's chair, Roz is smoking near the balcony window._

speaker: Gil
text: Will you stop that infernal bouncing?

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, sir.  No, sir.  Gotta keep moving.  Constant movement equals constant calorie burn.  You sure you guys don't want some appetite suppressants?

speaker: Roz
text: What the hell are those things anyway?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_over-stimulated_] They're fine, they're fine, they're natural, they have ginseng.  _He takes another shot of them, and begins to do stair exercises again. Frasier is standing in front of the door and is bumped when Niles and Martin try to enter._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on in, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we had a bit of a discipline breakdown.  We've all agreed to spend the last twelve hours before the final weigh- in policing each other.  It's a good thing you had dinner out. I've purged the apartment of all foodstuffs.

speaker: Niles
text: Who's that gentleman on the floor?

speaker: All
text: Noel.

speaker: Frasier
text: He passes out from time to time, but not to worry, I'm sure the next searing stomach cramp will bring him around.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_patting Noel on the back_] There you are.  You can set your watch by him.  All right, everybody.  I believe my bathroom has probably finished its transformation into a steam room by now.  If you'll all join me, we can relax and sweat off a few extra ounces.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_excitedly_] Okay, you heard the doc, let's go, let's go, let's go.  _Frasier leads them all back, Bulldog shepherding them from the rear. He slaps Noel's head as they go.  Niles and Martin approach the box on the bookcase containing the bird._

speaker: Niles
text: [_opening the box_] Hey, Barney.  How's my favorite patient?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, making progress.  He doesn't even flinch anymore at the sound of your voice.

speaker: Niles
text: He's letting me stroke his wing.  You know what?  I'm going to put this birdseed in a bowl.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to the bird_] Oh, you know, there's a sad little fellow who's been dying to say hello to you all day.

speaker: Martin
text: That's better.  Eddie, come on, say hello.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, my God, Eddie!  Eddie!

speaker: Niles
text: [_o.s._] Hey, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming out of the kitchen with a bowl_] I've been thinking. You know...

speaker: Martin
text: [_shushing him_] Shh.  Keep it quiet.  That wing rub you gave him put him right to sleep.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's kind of sweet.  Well, uh, I'll just go home.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, Dad, I think he may like me even more than he likes Eddie.

speaker: Martin
text: [_with simultaneous irony and truth_] No contest.  _Niles exits.  Martin heads back.  FADE TO:  Scene 7 - Frasier's bathroom The room is filled with steam.  The "team" are all there, only visible as an odd arm and leg here and there.  Bulldog is still wearing his jumpsuit, Roz is wearing a robe, and the other men are wearing towels._

speaker: Bulldog
text: How much longer, Doc?

speaker: Frasier
text: Another half an hour.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't keep my cigarette lit.

speaker: Noel
text: [_weakly_] Roz, take my hand.

speaker: Roz
text: Fine, Noel, I'll take your stupid hand.

speaker: Roz
text: Where are you...?

speaker: Gil
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God!  Put on a towel, you perv.

speaker: Gil
text: If I had known this sort of thing went on in steam rooms, I'd never have let you lure me in.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, just relax, team.  Feel the steam literally melting the pounds away.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, I'm about to faint.  I'm going to grab some water.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You sure you want to leave him alone out there?  He could be on his way to Pizza Hut.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good point.  I'll just go check on him.

speaker: Roz
text: It's weird, my skin tastes kind of salty.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, I'd say mostly sweet, but a little salty.  Heh, heh, heh.

speaker: Roz
text: That wasn't me, Bulldog.

speaker: Gil
text: That was me you licked.  And if it happens again, I shall consider it strike one.  _CUT TO: Kenny walking toward the kitchen wearing a robe.  On the way he sees the birdseed and samples it._

speaker: Kenny
text: Mmm.  _He walks back to the kitchen.  Frasier follows, belting his robe. On the way, he observes the bird's feathers on the floor.  He picks one up and releases it, horrified.  He opens the bird's box, sees the bird is gone, and jumps back.  Kenny enters from the kitchen, licking his finger and picking his teeth.  Frasier eyes him with suspicion and shock.  Kenny looks guilty._

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny... what did you just eat?

speaker: Kenny
text: [_sucking his teeth_] Nothing.

speaker: Frasier
text: You have a toothpick!

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, all right, I couldn't take it anymore.  I only had a mouthful.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_screaming_] Dear God!  _The rest of the team rushes in.  Noel and Gil are now wearing robes, and Gil -- this kills me -- has a pink towel wrapped turban-style around his head._

speaker: Bulldog
text: What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: This ravenous madman's just eaten a live pigeon!

speaker: Kenny
text: No, I didn't!  I only had some seeds.

speaker: Gil
text: If Kenny gets seeds, we all get seeds.

speaker: Roz
text: Where are they?

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, get away!  I saw them first!

speaker: Roz
text: No, give me those!  _The bowl goes flying and scatters birdseed all over the floor. They clamber over Martin's chair, diving for the birdseed._

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!  Stop it!  Stop this madness!  Look at yourselves!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, we are hours away from victory and look at you, plucking around the floor like a clutch of crazed capons. Try to conjure up some image to give us strength.  Imagine yourselves winning.  Imagine yourselves in Vegas!

speaker: Roz
text: [_whining_] I'm still hungry!

speaker: Martin
text: Stay out of the hallway, Eddie just threw up a dead pigeon, and now he's eating it again.  _Martin exits.  They all rise saying such things as "Okay, that's it," and "That'll do it for me."  Kenny spits out the seed residue in his mouth.  FADE TO:  Scene 8 - Channel 6 Studio Kelly Kirkland introduces the segment._

speaker: Kelly
text: Next up, the final weigh-in in our Fat to Fit Weight Loss Challenge, so stay right here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  Everybody take off your watches, jewelry, hairpins, shoes, anything that'll add just an ounce of weight.

speaker: Wayne
text: Hey, Crane!  Looking forward to seeing you in your field hockey skirt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yeah?  I'm going to be so busy playing with that new chess set you're gonna buy me that I won't even have time to put on my skirt... Not that I still have it!

speaker: Kelly
text: Welcome back!  And here they are, come on in folks!  KPXY, you're up first.  _The KPXY team is weighed.  Instead of a one-person scale, for the final weigh-in they've prepared a trampoline-sized scale for the whole team, with a big electronic display._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Okay, guys.  Huddle up, here's the plan.  I'll stand in the middle.  You surround me, and lift me up, so I'm not even touching the scale.

speaker: Bulldog
text: What?

speaker: Kelly
text: Wow, you have lost an impressive 44 pounds, 2 ounces.  Great job, guys!

speaker: Noel
text: [_delirious_] I see giant steaks with legs.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You're hallucinating. [_He slaps Noel's head._] Just pull it together.

speaker: Kenny
text: Uh, no, he's right.  It's the Beef Council Dancers.  They're on after us.

speaker: Kelly
text: Okay, Team KACL, up you go.

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, my goodness!  44 pounds even.  You lose by two ounces!

speaker: Roz
text: No!  I'm not getting emphysema for this.  _She reaches for her purse and grabs a pair of scissors, handing it to Gil.  She then lifts her ponytail._

speaker: Roz
text: Cut me!

speaker: Gil
text: I can't!

speaker: Roz
text: Cut me, damn it!  _Gil grimaces as he does so.  Roz puts down her ponytail and the scissors.  The scale now changes to 44 lb. 3 oz._

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, my God!  44 pounds, 3 ounces!  They're on their way to Vegas!  _The KACL team cheers (as does the studio audience).  The KPXY team reacts with disgust, and appear to want to cry foul.  The KACL team goes off to the side_

speaker: Kelly
text: Don't go away!  When we come back, we have a little dance number that's both "rare" and "well done."  _She smiles broadly.  The show fades out to music.  Shafter approaches Frasier._

speaker: Wayne
text: Okay, Crane, you won.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I did, Shafter.

speaker: Wayne
text: So, where do I pick up this chess set?

speaker: Frasier
text: The Rook Nook.  Ask for Cyril.  Tell him you were sent by Dr. Frasier Crane...

speaker: Frasier
text: PSYCH...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...iatrist.  _The KACL team cheers, giving Frasier hugs and high-fives.  FADE OUT_
